website_summaries.verdict: If you find memory foam too firm for comfort, this foam half moon booster pillow may do the trick.
pros: Foam honeycomb, half-moon pillow with a soft, substantial zippered cover that can be removed for washing
Softer and gentler on joints than some other options
cons: Some say the pillow isn't tall enough to support their knees
May be best for shorter customers

customer_reviews.title: My new best friend
customer_reviews.text: I have neck, knee, and back issues, so getting to sleep comfortably can be difficult some nights. I have been a side sleeper for years, although I like to sit up in bed and read. This allows me to use this pillow in multiple ways. 1. I sleep with it between my legs at night. Because it is the perfect length and width, it moves easily with me as I move around. 2. As I sit up to read, it allows me to maintain comfort in my lower back with my knees elevated, but not too high. It’s really the perfect amount of cushion. I recommend this to all who are unsure, you will love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ferrates

customer_reviews.title: NIce product but could be stiffer

customer_reviews.title: Results the first night.

It came fast and was clean and without smells (I've read horror stories about buying cushions that were dirty or smelled of mold). She had little to no pain after using it for the first night and after a 2 more nights she was waking up with no pain at all. She appreciated that she could take out one of the cushions for more of a comfortable fit and, along with her morning stretches, she was so happy to be rid of that pain in her neck - and so was I :)

I thought I’d give this a try and it Worked Wonders❣️ I’m a side sleeper and the curve and height of the pillow keep my ankle supported, I haven’t had a pin slip since I started using it.
